page.title: 13BEGINNINGS OF OUR SCHOOL
page.content: The old school was built at a cost of Â£120 in 1841. The land for it was given by Earl Ferrers. There were 45 children attending the school in 1844 and 55 in 1900. Some of the lessons were English, arithmetic, geography, history, elementary science, singing, drawing, needlework and gardening. They played sports like football, rouders, cricket and shinty. Inspectors came to see the conditions of the old school and to see the children's work. The vicar came to give scripture lessons, which the children had quite a lot of. The infants did not have a proper teacher. They had a pupil teacher instead. The school often closed for illnesses, like whooping cough and measles.
